{"step_by_step_thinking": "Glucogenic substances are those that can be converted into glucose through gluconeogenesis. Pyruvate, oxaloacetate, and lactate are all substances that can be converted into glucose. However, Acetyl-CoA is not glucogenic because it cannot be converted back into glucose. Instead, it enters the citric acid cycle to be oxidized for energy.", "answer_choice": "C. Acetyl-CoA"}
